intro: Echinochloa walteri var. laevigata, commonly known as smooth稗, is a grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown spikelets. It thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in rice paddies and other moist environments. Due to its rapid growth, it can become a weed in agricultural settings.
